intro: Erechtites bathurstianus, commonly known as the Bathurst dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. It produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads. The leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
